intro: Trichochloa microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded trichochloa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its reproductive strategy in open habitats. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
